experience: You and Matthew both know Mike Alonzo, Leah Shanker, and 9 others
You both worked at Northern Arizona University
You both worked at Northern Arizona University from Sep 2007 to May 2009

• Developed a department-wide dashboard application in JavaScript, Angular, Python, Flask, Postgres, and SQLAlchemy that provided an immediate overview of product health across business groups and product categories with drill-down into detailed statistics and time trends.• Wrote Python and PERL automation scripts to collect data from four separate databases and create a merged voltage report with charting that saved engineers several hours of manual operation and Excel manipulation.• Improved software development policies to include version control, bug tracking, and release tagging with Git which increased developer productivity and also streamlined the release process from a manual, 4-step checklist to a single automated script.• General maintenance of Python and PERL web applications using a variety of other technologies including MySQL, REST APIs, C/C++, Bootstrap and Angular frameworks, as well as Sass and SCSS CSS languages.• Improved both internal and external documentation of all projects in using TexInfo, Docstrings, and internal Wikis to provide web- and PDF-based guides.

• Owned a product from design through infant production, volume manufacturing, to end-of-life. Responsible for discovering, investigating and solving or mitigating all issues with the product with help from fabrication, test, burn-in, design, and QA departments.• Used a number of high-speed and high-volume testers including Advantest and internal platforms to identify the severity of issues both in single-unit functionality and whole-line effects.• Problems were either solved with silicon edits planned in Cadence DF2 and simulated using various SPICE flavors, or mitigated using functional tests written in Python, T55xx assembly, and internal languages with a focus on efficiency.• Developed a new-product operating current test scheme that saved dozens of engineering and process hours by automating the test process and writing a PERL application to analyze the tester output.

• Modernized the key plan and recoding system• Installed, repaired and serviced over 2,000,000 physical and electronic locks on campus• Trained new employees on security, maintenance and administrative procedures• Designed and documented procedures at all levels for new electronic access system• Revised and streamlined the key tracking systems for increased security and convenience
Undergraduate Researcher, Wireless Networks Research Lab

• Designed embedded systems for environmental research from design through schematic, layout, manufacturing, population, programming and deployment.• Wrote embedded C code for new hardware as well as upgrades to existing code.• Extensive debugging and problem solving on hardware and software systems.• Documented new and existing systems and procedures.

• Worked through the levels of employment from Customer ServiceAssociate to Director of Technology.• Supported more than 25 franchisees and their employees in more than 50 locations across the nation.• Created company policy and procedures for technical aspects of the business.• Documented existing and new policies and procedures, and trained staff, franchisees and employees both in-person and remotely.• Mentored a group of franchisees on all aspects of their business,and acted as a liaison between them and other departments of thecompany.• Interviewed, hired and managed a team in charge of the corporate Extranet (web-based company management software).
Tau Beta Pi Member, NAU IEEE Student Chapter, IEEE Student Member, Supplemental Instructor (tutor) for ﬁrst- and second-year circuits courses, Dean’s List of Distinguished Students

• GPA 3.8 in major, 3.7 overall• Graduated cum Laude• Courses in team-based design, digital signal processing, electromagnetics, power electronics, wireless communications, and embedded control.• Major design projects include a human-powered AC generator, a metamaterial-based electrically-small antenna system, a microcontroller designed in VHDL and implemented on a FPGA, and a 2-axis solar tracking controller.

When I began hiring for the Web Architect position, I had only two criteria for candidates: they must be smart, and they must get things done. Nate exceeded both those criteria .I was able to hand Nate a stack of complex and involved projects and be assured that he would complete them in a timely manner, and with minimal support from myself--which is exactly what I hired him to do. Nate was also able to work with employees from other departments ranging from graphic design to marketing, speak their language, and translate that into technical specs.Nate was a welcome addition to a small, agile team of unique and unorthodox employees. He fit in well whether working with techies or executives.
